model

Class Pylon

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractGameObject
      • model.AbstractFixedGameObject
        • model.Pylon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICollider, IDrawable, IGameObject, ISelectable

    public class Pylon
extends AbstractFixedGameObject
implements ISelectable
    A game representation of a pylon.
    Author:
    Robert Wilk

      Pylon(int sequenceNumber, double radius, Location2D location, java.awt.Color color)
      In addition to the data taken by the super AbstractFixedGameObject.AbstractFixedGameObject(Color, Location2D, Shape) class, this constructor takes the sequence number and radius of the pylon.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Description copied from class: AbstractGameObject
        This is method is not intended to be invoked by any child class users directly. To change the color of a game object which implements IColorable use IColorable.changeColor(Color) to do so. This method will throw UnsupportedOperationException if invoked on a game object with a static color.
        Overrides:
        setColor in class AbstractGameObject
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the object.
